vogar.monitor

Class HostMonitor

  • java.lang.Object
    • vogar.monitor.HostMonitor

  • public final class HostMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
    Connects to a target process to monitor its action using XML over raw sockets.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  HostMonitor.Handler
      Handles updates on the outcomes of a target process.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean attach(int port)
      Returns true if the target process completed normally.
      private boolean followProcess(InterleavedReader reader)
      Our wire format is a mix of strings and the JSON values like the following: {"outcome"="java.util.FormatterMain"} {"result"="SUCCESS"} {"outcome"="java.util.FormatterTest#testBar" runner="vogar.target.junit.JUnitRunner"} {"result"="SUCCESS"} {"completedNormally"=true}
      boolean followStream(java.io.InputStream in) 
      private boolean checkStream(java.io.InputStream in)
      Somewhere between the host and client process, broken socket connections are being accepted.

      • attach

        public boolean attach(int port)
               throws java.io.IOException
        Returns true if the target process completed normally.

      • checkStream

        private boolean checkStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Somewhere between the host and client process, broken socket connections are being accepted. Before we try to do any work on such a connection, check it to make sure it's not dead! TODO: file a bug (against adb?) for this
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • followStream

        public boolean followStream(java.io.InputStream in)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:

      • followProcess

        private boolean followProcess(InterleavedReader reader)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Our wire format is a mix of strings and the JSON values like the following: {"outcome"="java.util.FormatterMain"} {"result"="SUCCESS"} {"outcome"="java.util.FormatterTest#testBar" runner="vogar.target.junit.JUnitRunner"} {"result"="SUCCESS"} {"completedNormally"=true}
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
